intro: Monticalia elatoides, commonly known as the red-flowered rock heath, is a member of the Ericaceae family and is native to South America. It is a small shrub characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant features showy, bell-shaped red flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are typically small, leathery, and evergreen, adapted to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. Monticalia elatoides is often found in high-altitude regions, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
